physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Esophagogastroduodenoscopy revealed a pedunculated polypoid lesion of the gastric fornix 8 mm from the esophagogastric junction, covered with a smooth, whitish mucosal layer.
Detailed inspection using laryngoscopy confirmed LTEC (type III).
During surgery, a tumor palpable on the posterior wall of the fundus, near the gastric cardia.
